info.title: Personnel Data
info.description: API for reading and writing personnel data incl. data about attendances and absences

post.description: Creates new employee. Status of the employee will be set to `active` if `hire_date` provided is in past. Otherwise status will be set to `onboarding`. This endpoint will respond with `id` of created employee in case of success.

parameters.name: employee_id
parameters.description: Numeric `id` of the employee

parameters.description: Numeric `id` of the employee

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: Width of the image. Default 75x75

get.description: This endpoint is responsible for fetching attendance data for the company employees. It is possible to paginate results, filter by period, the date and/or time it was updated, and/or specific employees. The result will contain a list of attendance periods, structured as defined here.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: First day of the period to be queried. It is inclusive, so the day specified as start_date will also be considered on the results

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Last day of the period to be queried. It is inclusive, so the day specified as end_date will also be considered on the results.

parameters.name: updated_from
parameters.description: Datetime from when the queried periods have been updated. Same format as updated_at. It is inclusive, so the day specified as updated_from will also be considered on the results. Can be just the date, or the date and the time, with or without the timezone.

parameters.name: updated_to
parameters.description: Datetime until when the queried periods have been updated. Same format as updated_at. It is inclusive, so the day specified as updated_to will also be considered on the results. Can be just the date, or the date and the time, with or without the timezone.

parameters.name: employees
parameters.description: A list of Personio employee identifiers to filter the results. Only those employees specified here will be returned.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Pagination attribute to limit how many attendances will be returned per page

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Pagination attribute to identify which page you are requesting, by the form of telling an offset from the first record that would be returned.

post.description: This endpoint is responsible for adding attendance data for the company employees. It is possible to add attendances for one or many employees at the same time. The payload sent on the request should be a list of attendance periods, in the form of an array containing attendance period objects.

schema.title: Create a New Attendance Period request

requestBody.description: List of attendance periods to create

200.description: The attendance periods were created successfully

error.message: Error when trying to insert Attendances periods rows

delete.description: This endpoint is responsible for deleting attendance data for the company employees.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the attendance period to delete

error.message: The attendance period was not found.

patch.description: This endpoint is responsible for updating attendance data for the company employees. Attributes are not required and if not specified, the current value will be used. It is not possible to change the employee id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the attendance period to update

error.message: The attendance period was not found.
